p: “Original Antigenic Sin (OAS)” refers to the phenomenon that the antibody response to the first influenza virus variant one encounters dominates the anti-influenza virus antibody response lifelong (reviewed in (Henry et al. 2018)). To date, the knowledge of how past influenza exposure shapes the response to subsequent antigenically distinct influenza strains remains obscure. Although “antigen imprinting” strategy has shown positive impact in the context of the development of a “stalk-based” universal influenza virus vaccine, the complex immune response underlying OAS more or less stymies the development of universal influenza vaccines (Cohen 2018).
